alert.note: Alert for Davidson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 23 at 2:34PM EDT until May 23 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DAVIDSON COUNTY... At 234 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles north of Badin Lake, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Davidson County, including the following locations... High Rock, Denton and High Rock Lake. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
